commands.heading: What are CSS Animations?
commands.description: CSS Animations allow you to animate the transition between CSS property values over time.

commands.heading: Why Use CSS Animations?
commands.description: CSS Animations can enhance user experience by making interfaces more dynamic and engaging.

commands.heading: @keyframes
commands.description: Defines the keyframes of the animation, specifying the styles at each point in the animation sequence.

commands.heading: Using Keyframes
commands.description: Apply the keyframes to an element using the `animation` property.

commands.heading: animation-name
commands.description: Specifies the name of the `@keyframes` animation to apply.

commands.heading: animation-duration
commands.description: Specifies the duration of the animation.

commands.heading: animation-timing-function
commands.description: Specifies the speed curve of the animation.

commands.heading: animation-delay
commands.description: Specifies a delay before the animation starts.

commands.heading: animation-iteration-count
commands.description: Specifies the number of times the animation should repeat.

commands.heading: animation-direction
commands.description: Specifies whether the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

commands.heading: animation-fill-mode
commands.description: Specifies how a CSS animation should apply styles to its target before and after it is executing.

commands.heading: animation-play-state
commands.description: Specifies whether the animation is running or paused.
